title.narrative: OUPUT 2.1.3: INSTITUTIONNAL STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Targeted communities have the capacity to define and adhere to social norms favourable to pre-schooling and keeping children and adolescents in school, particularly girls and children living with disabilities., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Conflict Prevention, Fragility And Peacebuilding, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls and boys of school age (4â€“19 years), particularly the most disadvantaged, have access to quality education and training and acquire basic skills.

Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Targeted communities have the capacity to define and adhere to social norms favourable to pre-schooling and keeping children andadolescents in school, particularly girls and children living with disabilities.

description.narrative: In 2021 the CO supported communities and NGOs by helping to develop their capacity to improve participation and mutual accountability in efforts to support the right of all girls and boys to education. Mothers and Girls’ Clubs (CMEF) contributed to the enrolment and retention of children in 117 community-based pre-primary centres as a result of parental education and income-generating activities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2022
